Topic.Title: The urgly news : The Catch in Kindle’s Data Plan

Message.Msg: It wasn't meant for video and video calls if you have free skype pre-loaded why would you need to make data plan video calls anyway. It saves consumers about $500 compared to the cheapest ipad + data plan which offers a similar amount of data. A lot of consumers are going to find that very attractive. They'll just download movies to their PC and transfer them via USB to save on that $500.

Topic.Title: The urgly news : The Catch in Kindle’s Data Plan

Message.Msg: It is only useless if you don't own a PC. People simply download via PC and transfer via USB cable to their devices. That is the same way an ipod for example works. Funny how these shorts think that Amazon hasn't already thought of all this, and that they, the shorts, were the first ones to think of it. Obviously none of the shorts have never used Prime or Amazon downloads or they'd know how the system works. As for the $50 per year for that amount of data this price is extremely low and attractive.

Message.Title: AMZN's business model is unstable - will explode in face
Message.Msg: AMZN has been reporting declining profits (in fact last quarter they lost money and will lose money in 3Q12) because of declining margins. Margins are lower because they are spending heavily on new technologies that are helping AMZN with revenue growth. The trailing PE of 306 and forward PE of 106 (highest among technology companies by a factor of 10 and 20) are justified by those who believe in spending-today and reaping -profits tomorrow philosophy. The problem is when they stop spending on R&D, the revenue growth will decline - would the market then focus on profits and ignore revenue growth rate? It's very tricky business model and there are no guarantees that AMZN's profit will double or even triple that some are expecting, while burning cash today. I think trailing PE of 306 and forward PE of 106 are extrenely risky given the instability of the business model. I am surprised that there are investors who believe this novel way to look at stocks even without entertaining any thought that things may not turn out as they are speculating given the highly volatile naature of the technology market. These kinds of PE's could have been justified in 1999-2001 period when NASDAQ PE's were astronomically high in 100'sv but today when NASDAQ PE is in 30's, AMZN's PE's look outrageously high and therefore very risky. If spending cuts lead to slow revenue growth, these kinds of PE's can't be sustained and conceivably AMZN stock could collapse to under 100. There are several companies that are growing revenues and profits at rates higher than AMZN and yet they have PE's of one-seventh of that of AMZN (e.g., AAPL and Google). It's extraordinary that in this age of sluggish markets, AMZN is assigned bubble-like PEs.

Topic.Title: AMZN's business model is unstable - will explode in face

Message.Msg: There are no investors in this bubble markets. Traders and funds pile on high-priced stocks because these stocks move the market. There is no fear because of the believe that the Fed will always bail out WS. At some point in the future, the Fed will be irrelevant due to other world events or macroeconomic forces. Internet stocks popped. Housing stocks popped. Social media/internet infomation providers and retailers will also pop. Scamazon life-blood will always be a mail order retailer. These technology ventures are designed to mask a shrinking margin core business. Time is the cure for this disease.

Topic.Title: AMZN's business model is unstable - will explode in face

Message.Msg: AMZM announced that they don't yet have FCC approval for wireless access - that's strange they announce a product without having all the approvals. They expect to get the approval by Nov 15 - but what if they don't, they will miss out this year's shopping season. AMZN under criticism bacltracked and said that they will let users opt out from ads for $15. Earlier plan was to force ads on to the users and users expressed unhappiness over that. Not a flawless execution, I would say!

Topic.Title: AMZN's business model is unstable - will explode in face

Message.Msg: Just to prove that Scamazon can no longer compete on price with tablets by tacking on a $15 surcharge on all tablets. That's like buying a car with ads supported AM/FM radio. To kill the ads, the owner must pay another 7.5% premium. What a scam!

Message.Title: To Da moon !!
Message.Msg: I am not worried about a replay of AMZN falling from $354.94 to $8.60 in less than three years (1/4/99 to 1120/01). They have a much better business model now. Profits are on the way up in the past two years. They make lots of money on their new hand held devices such a Kindle Fire. They have a very smart, business-like CEO who strikes everyone as he knows what he is doing. Their P/E is low just like the other discount retailers in the on-line business. Their stock price will never fall hard again. They are a better profit center than AAPL. No problem !! Buy like there is no tomorrow.
